cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi NNE of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the Turks and Caicos and Bahamas, forecast to reach south Florida Sunday, then curve northward across the Florida Peninsula and into Georgia/South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Florida (near the Florida Keys / Miami area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge and Hurricane Watches posted from Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach including the Florida Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for the Dominican Republic north coast, Haiti north coast, Turks and Caicos, and the Bahamas (southeastern, central, northwestern)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from south Florida northward through Georgia and South Carolina lies within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are 65% likely in the next five days, with up to a 34% chance of sustained 50-kt winds as the core tracks inland west of the port late Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center tracks just inland, onshore winds could drive 3–5 ft of surge into the Savannah River entrance and adjacent barrier islands.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands associated with Irma may bring 4–8 inches of rain to coastal Georgia Monday–Tuesday, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend; possible river flooding inland after Monday.
